contentfulPagePressRelease.title: Qatar MICE Development Institute Successfully Concludes Activities for Commercial Bank Qatar Masters 2015

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Qatar MICE Development Institute (QMDI), a joint venture with Qatar Foundation (QF), concluded its activities for fans and partners this weekend as part of its Gold Sponsorship of the Commercial Bank Qatar Masters 2015.

The event is part of the European Tour and this year saw Branden Grace raise the Mother of Pearl trophy, taking home the majority share of the $2.5 million tournament prize fund at Doha Golf Club.

QMDI engaged fans and guests in a range of activities, including a bespoke stand in the Public Pavilion and branded VIP chalet, playing an integral role in executing the event that hosts international golf stars and thousands of local visitors. Activities throughout the week included family friendly opportunities to win prizes and meet and greets with touring players including PGA Golf Professionals Mark Reynolds, Henrik Stenson, Marcel Siem and Thorbjørn Olesen.

Sporting fans visited the QMDI-hosted areas and took part in competitions such as the ‘Ball-Catcher’ where guests tested their reflexes with balloons and the ‘Reaction Wall’ that challenged guests to hit as many lights in 30 seconds. Young visitors to the golf tournament were also offered entertainment in a dedicated area where children could explore their creativity through many interactive activities.

QMDI also teamed up with Qatar Foundation Radio to offer lucky winners the opportunity to attend the Commercial Bank Qatar Masters 2015 for free.

For the full story, please click here.
